title: 111_s2901
content:
The Act titled "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the long-term improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce by developing new leaders with government-wide perspective and recruiting individuals with outstanding academic backgrounds. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a program to recruit individuals with academic merit, ethical values, business acumen, and leadership skills to meet Federal Government acquisition needs. The program offers advancement opportunities, competitive compensation, and leadership roles at executive agencies through contracts with qualified universities. The program established by the Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 aims to recruit individuals with academic merit, ethical values, business acumen, and leadership skills for Government acquisition. It includes one academic year of on-campus training followed by two years of on-the-job training towards a Masters degree. The curriculum involves rotational assignments at executive agencies covering various acquisition aspects. The program established by the Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 focuses on recruiting individuals with academic merit, ethical values, business acumen, and leadership skills for Government acquisition. It includes training on different types of contracts, terminations, contract close-out, required training courses, transparency, accountability, integrity, and other necessary education. Priority is given to employment opportunities. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 prioritizes hiring program graduates for acquisition field positions at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels based on performance and qualifications. No hiring should violate merit system principles. The program limits the number of participants to 200 per year, with a minimum of 50 in the first year, 100 in the second year, and 150 thereafter. The Administrator must collaborate with qualified universities to implement the program. The program requires cooperative agreements with qualified universities for management, oversight, and placement of participants upon graduation. Universities can select and remove participants based on academic processes, and career development is periodically reviewed post-placement. The program requires participants to commit to federal employment in acquisition for a specified term to ensure a proper return on investment. The program requires candidates to commit to federal employment in acquisition for a specified term. Candidates who do not complete the program or meet service requirements must reimburse the Federal Government for funds received. A fund called the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is established in the Treasury for program use. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is used for the program's establishment, operations, and awarding contracts for student expenses like tuition, room and board, travel, and stipends. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is used for the program's establishment, operations, awarding contracts for student expenses like tuition, room and board, travel, stipends, planning, administration, and other necessary expenses as determined by the Administrator. The Fund consists of appropriated or otherwise made available amounts. The Administrator will submit reports on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including a preliminary report within 120 days of enactment and annual reports thereafter. The Administrator will submit reports on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including a description of activities, assessment of effectiveness, and performance of administering universities. The Administrator will submit reports on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including activities, effectiveness assessment, and performance of administering universities. Recommendations for legislative or administrative action may be included for appropriate congressional committees. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund:
- $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2011
- $32,000,000 for fiscal year 2012
- $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2013.
